verses.kjv: And Isaac called Jacob, and blessed him, and charged him, and said unto him, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.
verses.ct: Isaac summoned Jacob, blessed him, and gave him this instruction: "You must not marry any of the Canaanite women."

verses.kjv: Arise, go to Padanaram, to the house of Bethuel thy mother’s father; and take thee a wife from thence of the daughters of Laban thy mother’s brother.
verses.ct: "Travel to Padanaram, to the household of Bethuel, your mother's father, and find a wife there from among the daughters of Laban, your mother's brother."

verses.kjv: And God Almighty bless thee, and make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, that thou mayest be a multitude of people;
verses.ct: "May God Almighty bless you, make you fruitful, and multiply you until you become a great community of peoples."

verses.kjv: And give thee the blessing of Abraham, to thee, and to thy seed with thee; that thou mayest inherit the land wherein thou art a stranger, which God gave unto Abraham.
verses.ct: "May he grant you the blessing of Abraham — to you and your descendants — so that you may possess the land where you have been living as a foreigner, the land God gave to Abraham."

verses.kjv: And Isaac sent away Jacob: and he went to Padanaram unto Laban, son of Bethuel the Syrian, the brother of Rebekah, Jacob’s and Esau’s mother.
verses.ct: Then Isaac sent Jacob on his way, and he traveled to Padanaram, to Laban, the son of Bethuel the Syrian, who was the brother of Rebekah, the mother of Jacob and Esau.

verses.kjv: When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob, and sent him away to Padanaram, to take him a wife from thence; and that as he blessed him he gave him a charge, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan;
verses.ct: Esau learned that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him off to Padanaram to find a wife there, and that when blessing him, Isaac had commanded him, "You must not marry any of the Canaanite women."

verses.kjv: And that Jacob obeyed his father and his mother, and was gone to Padanaram;
verses.ct: He also saw that Jacob had listened to his father and mother and had left for Padanaram.

verses.kjv: And Esau seeing that the daughters of Canaan pleased not Isaac his father;
verses.ct: Esau realized that the Canaanite women were displeasing to his father Isaac.

verses.kjv: Then went Esau unto Ishmael, and took unto the wives which he had Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael Abraham’s son, the sister of Nebajoth, to be his wife.
verses.ct: So Esau went to Ishmael and married Mahalath, the daughter of Abraham's son Ishmael and the sister of Nebajoth, adding her to the wives he already had.

verses.kjv: And Jacob went out from Beersheba, and went toward Haran.
verses.ct: Jacob departed from Beersheba and set out for Haran.

verses.kjv: And he lighted upon a certain place, and tarried there all night, because the sun was set; and he took of the stones of that place, and put them for his pillows, and lay down in that place to sleep.
verses.ct: He came to a certain place and stopped there for the night because the sun had gone down. He took one of the stones from that spot, placed it under his head, and lay down to sleep.

verses.kjv: And he dreamed, and behold a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven: and behold the angels of God ascending and descending on it.
verses.ct: He had a dream in which he saw a ladder resting on the earth with its top reaching up to heaven, and the angels of God were going up and coming down on it.

verses.kjv: And, behold, the LORD stood above it, and said, I am the LORD God of Abraham thy father, and the God of Isaac: the land whereon thou liest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed;
verses.ct: The LORD stood above it and said, "I am the LORD God of your father Abraham and the God of Isaac. The ground you are lying on I will give to you and your descendants."

verses.kjv: And thy seed shall be as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south: and in thee and in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
verses.ct: "Your descendants will be as numerous as the dust of the earth, and you will spread out to the west, the east, the north, and the south. Through you and your offspring, every family on earth will be blessed."

verses.kjv: And, behold, I am with thee, and will keep thee in all places whither thou goest, and will bring thee again into this land; for I will not leave thee, until I have done that which I have spoken to thee of.
verses.ct: "I am with you and will watch over you wherever you go, and I will bring you back to this land. I will not abandon you until I have accomplished everything I have promised you."

verses.kjv: And Jacob awaked out of his sleep, and he said, Surely the LORD is in this place; and I knew it not.
verses.ct: Jacob woke from his sleep and said, "The LORD is truly in this place, and I did not realize it."

verses.kjv: And he was afraid, and said, How dreadful is this place! this is none other but the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven.
verses.ct: He was filled with fear and said, "How awesome this place is! This can only be the house of God — this is the gate of heaven."

verses.kjv: And Jacob rose up early in the morning, and took the stone that he had put for his pillows, and set it up for a pillar, and poured oil upon the top of it.
verses.ct: Jacob got up early the next morning, took the stone he had placed under his head, stood it upright as a pillar, and poured oil on top of it.

verses.kjv: And he called the name of that place Bethel: but the name of that city was called Luz at the first.
verses.ct: He named that place Bethel, though the city had previously been known as Luz.

verses.kjv: And Jacob vowed a vow, saying, If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on,
verses.ct: Then Jacob made a vow, saying, "If God will be with me and protect me on this journey, and provide me with food to eat and clothing to wear,

verses.kjv: So that I come again to my father’s house in peace; then shall the LORD be my God:
verses.ct: so that I return safely to my father's house, then the LORD will be my God.

verses.kjv: And this stone, which I have set for a pillar, shall be God’s house: and of all that thou shalt give me I will surely give the tenth unto thee.
verses.ct: This stone that I have set up as a pillar will be God's house, and of everything you give me, I will surely return a tenth to you."
